name: quotability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being quotable (= suitable for being repeated by someone else): In terms of quotability, Mark Twain is the American Shakespeare. His popularity has a lot to do with his quotability.
More examplesFewer examplesIt was a classic episode with some great scenes and quotability from start to finish.The group's members are well-known for their quotability, increasing the influence of their relatively small organization.The script's jokes don't achieve the instant quotability of golden-age Hollywood, but they come close enough.
